title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17ยง 2.3 - Personal privacy compliance officer
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17ยง 2.3 - Personal privacy compliance officer

State Regulations
(a) The records access officer is hereby designated the personal privacy compliance
officer and is responsible for insuring that the department complies with the
provisions of the Personal Privacy Protection Law and this Part. (b) The personal privacy compliance officer
shall: (1)
coordinate the department's
response to requests for access or amendment, correction or disclosure of
records as provided in this Part; (2)
maintain a current list of department
records that contain personal information retrievable by use of a data
subject's name or other identifier; (3)
assist data subjects seeking to determine
if the department maintains records pertaining to them; (4)
(i) make
the records available for inspection in a form comprehensible to the data
subject and permit the data subject to copy the records; or
(ii)
deny access to the record, in whole or
in part, and explain the reasons therefor in writing; (5)
upon request, certify that a copy of a
record is a true copy; or
(6)
upon
request, certify that: (i) the department does
not have possession of the record sought; (ii)
the department cannot locate the record
sought after having made a diligent search; or
(iii)
the information sought cannot be
retrieved by use of the description furnished to the department or by the use
of the name or other identifier of the data subject without the use of
extraordinary search methods by the department. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 17ยง
2.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
